DESCRIPTION: Review of the nature of science, the basics of scientific investigation, and a comparison of hypotheses versus theories.
A look at the characteristics of a living thing, the four unifying principles of biology, and the interdependence of living things.
Review of the four basic classes of organic compounds: carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, and nucleic acids.
Overview of cell theory, cell properties, and cell structures. Also compares eukaryotic cells and prokaryotic cells.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.228.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.228.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.228.3.L.1, SCI.BIO.229.L.1, SCI.BIO.229.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.229.2.L.1
DESCRIPTION: A look at homeostasis and transport across membrane by passive transport and active transport.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.216.L.1, SCI.BIO.216.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.217.L.1, SCI.BIO.217.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.231.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.231.2.L.1
DESCRIPTION: How do organisms get energy? An overview of energy-carrying molecules, autotrophs versus heterotrophs, the basics of chemical reactions and activation energy, and enzymes.
Review of the photosynthesis and the two stages of photosynthesis: light reactions and Calvin cycle.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.236.L.1, SCI.BIO.236.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.237.L.1,  SCI.BIO.238.L.1, SCI.BIO.239.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.239.2.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Review of cellular respiration, including the roles of glycolysis, Krebs cycle, electron transport chain and ATP synthase. Also looks at anaerobic respiration (fermentation).
Overview of cell cycles for prokaryotes and eukaryotes, names for genetic material, binary fission, mitosis, and cytokinesis.
A comparison of asexual and sexual reproduction. Also looks at meiosis, genetic variation, and life cycles.
Overview of Mendel's pea plant experiments, including experimental steps, results, and conclusions.
A look at Mendelian inheritance and using Punnett squares to predict genotype and phenotype. A brief overview of non-Mendelian inheritance.
Review of chromosome type and structure and genes.
A look at inheritance that exhibit Mendelian pattern, pedigrees, non-Mendelian inheritance, and genetic disorders.
The science and applications of genetic engineering is the focus of this guide.
A brief overview of DNA replication.
A look at protein synthesis: the central dogma of molecular biology, genetic code (codons), types of RNA, transcription, and translation.
A guide about mutations: causes, types, and effects.
How genes are regulated in prokaryotes and eukaryotes.
A brief timeline of Earth's history and the origin of life, including RNA world hypothesis and endosymbiosis. Also looks at carbon dating.
A brief overview of important eras in Earth's history: the Late Precambrian Era; Cambrian explosion, Paleozoic Era, Permian extinction, Mesozoic Era, and Cenozoic Era.
A comparison of the Linnean classification and phylogenetic classification systems.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.422.L.1, SCI.BIO.423.L.1,  SCI.BIO.424.L.1, SCI.BIO.425.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.425.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.425.3.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Introduces Darwin's theory of evolution and natural selection. Also looks at some of the evidences supporting the theory of evolution (comparative anatomy, comparative embryology, biogeography).
A look at population genetics, the Hardy-Weinberg theorem, and the forces of evolution, such as genetic drift and natural selection. Also examines how natural selection affects phenotypes.
Examines the meaning of "species" and reviews causes of speciation. Looks at the timing of macroevolution.
Introduces ecology and looks at how organisms interact with the environment. Also reviews ecosystems, food chains, food webs, and trophic levels.
Looks at three important biogeochemical cycles: water cycle, carbon cycle, and nitrogen cycle.
A survey of terrestrial biomes and aquatic biomes.
Reviews three major types of community interactions: predation, competition, and symbiosis. Also looks at ecological succession.
A look at ways to describe population and population growth rate.
Examination of human population growth (past, present, and predicted future growth). Also discusses demographic transition.
Looks at the importance of biodiversity, the biodiversity crisis, and sixth mass extinction.
A comparison of renewable and nonrenewable resources, as well as an overview of several valuable natural resources. Also briefly looks at global climate change.
An overview of prokaryotes and their classification, structure, reproduction, and role in the world. Also discusses Gram staining.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.614.L.1, SCI.BIO.615.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.615.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.617.L.1, SCI.BIO.618.L.1, SCI.BIO.619.L.1
DESCRIPTION: A look at characteristics of viruses, viral reproduction, and the role of viruses in the world.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.621.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.622.L.1, SCI.BIO.623.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.623.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.623.3.L.1, SCI.BIO.628.L.1
DESCRIPTION: A brief look at the general characteristics of protists and three types of protists: protozoa, algae, and mold.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.624.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.624.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.624.3.L.1, SCI.BIO.625.L.1, SCI.BIO.626.L.1, SCI.BIO.627.L.1, SCI.BIO.629.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Overview of fungi and their general characteristics, reproduction, and role in the world. Also looks at the types of symbiotic relationships fungi can form.
An introduction to plants and their life cycle, evolution, classification, and importance.
A closer look at the characteristics, classification, and evolution of nonvascular plants, vascular plants, seed plants, and flowering plants.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.721.L.1, SCI.BIO.722.L.1, SCI.BIO.722.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.723.L.1, SCI.BIO.724.L.1, SCI.BIO.725.L.1, SCI.BIO.726.1.L.1
DESCRIPTION: An overview of the characteristics of plant cells, plant tissues, and plant organs (roots, stems, leaves).
An overview of life cycles for nonvascular plants, seedless vascular plants, gymnosperms, and angiosperms.
A brief look at plant adaptations to water, dryness, and air, as well as plant responses (tropisms) to external factors and diseases.
A look at animals and their characteristics, animal cells, nine major phyla of animals, invertebrates versus vertebrates, and major points of animal evolution.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.847.L.1, SCI.BIO.848.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.848.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.849.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.849.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.849.3.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Overview of animal behavior, such as innate, learned, social, cyclic, and reproductive behaviors. Also gives a brief review of the nature-nurture debate.
Overview of the characteristics of invertebrates (digestive system, movement, reproduction), invertebrate evolution, protostomes vs deuterostomes, and the major invertebrate phyla.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.821.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.821.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.822.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.822.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.823.L.1, SCI.BIO.824.L.1, SCI.BIO.825.L.1, SCI.BIO.826.L.1, SCI.BIO.827.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Looks at eight invertebrate phyla and the ecology, body structure, and reproduction of these invertebrates. Also looks further into anthropod and echinodermata classification.
The structure, reproduction, classification, evolution, and ecology of fish.
The structure, reproduction and development, classification, evolution, and diet of amphibians.
The structure, reproduction, classification, evolution, and ecology of reptiles.
The structure, reproduction, reproductive behavior, development, classification, evolution, and diet of birds.
The characteristics, structure, brain size/intelligence, social living, and locomotion of mammals.
A look at mammalian reproduction in placental mammals, marsupials, and monotremes.
Brief review of mammalian ancestors and evolution, as well as the classical and phylogenetic classifications of mammals.
Brief review of the organization of the human body and the importance of maintaining homeostasis.
A look at the skeletal system and the structure, growth, and development of bones. Also reviews skeletal injury and disease.
Reviews the three types of muscles (skeletal, cardiac, smooth) and muscle contraction (sliding filament theory).

EIDs: SCI.BIO.921.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.921.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.922.L.1, SCI.BIO.923.L.1, SCI.BIO.924.L.1, SCI.BIO.925.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Reviews the parts of nervous system (central and peripheral), parts of the brain, parts and types of nerve cells, nerve impulses, synapses and communication between neurons, and sense organs.
Looks at the endocrine system and the role of hormones, how hormones work, and how hormones are regulated. Also briefly reviews endocrine system disorders.

Overview of the circulatory system: the heart (chambers, valves), blood vessels (arteries, veins, capillaries), blood (components, blood type), pulmonary circuit, systemic circuit, and cardiovascular diseases.
Reviews the organs of respiratory system, the steps in respiration, the role of the diaphragm in contolling breathing, and respiratory diseases.
Reviews the functions of the digestive system and the path food takes through the digestive system (mouth, esophagus, stomach, small intestines, large intestines).
Looks at the organs of the excretory system, the urinary system (kidneys, nephron), the role of the kidney in maintaining homeostasis, and kidney diseases.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.941.L.1, SCI.BIO.942.L.1, SCI.BIO.943.L.1, SCI.BIO.944.L.1, SCI.BIO.945.L.1,  SCI.BIO.946.L.1
DESCRIPTION: The first part looking at the immune system: reviews the three lines of defense, lymphatic system, humoral immune response, cell-mediated response, and immunity.
The second part looking at the immune system: reviews allergies, autoimmune disease, and immunodeficiency (HIV and AIDS).
A brief overview of the effects of environmental problems on health: looks at pollution, carcinogen, and bioterrorism.
Looks at the male reproductive system (penis, testes, ducts, glands), spermatogenesis, and sexual development (puberty, adolescent growth).

Looks at the female reproductive system (vagina, uterus, fallopian tubes), egg production (oogenesis, maturation, ovulation, fertilization), sexual development (puberty, adolescent growth), menstruation, and menopause.

EIDs: SCI.BIO.955.L.1, SCI.BIO.956.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.956.2.L.1, SCI.BIO.957.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.958.1.L.1, SCI.BIO.958.2.L.1
DESCRIPTION: An outline of the events that occur between fertilization and old age: implantation, embryo and fetus growth and development, pregnancy and childbirth, infancy, adolescence, and adulthood.
Overview of sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and a comparison of bacterial STIs and viral STIs.
